title: (x) Catherine Campbell Spencerian script - Scriptofino {Trish}
content:
Hi,  
This is my first post :) I would appreciate if someone can help ID the script use for [Catherine Campbell](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203090033/http:/creaturecomforts.typepad.com/photos/uncategorized/2008/06/26/catherinecampbell.jpg) in the picture. I thought it was the "Splendid Script," but upon closer inspection, it wasn't.

Hope someone can help me =)

Thanks in advance!
author: gala1208

comments.content:
That's a hard one to search for. Its a Spencerian font as in Platt Rogers Spencer of the 19th century. Unfortunately, most type searches will lump copperplate scripts in with Spencerian because they are all formal pointed pen scripts.

A excellent example of a Spencerian style font is:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-zaner/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203090033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-zaner/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-zaner/")

or the thinner more casual:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-allyson/](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203090033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-allyson/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ihof/p22-allyson/")

Both are from Paul Hunt.
Thanks for your response Stephen :) I'm still stumped. Hope to find out soon.

Hi Lala,

this looks like [Penman](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203090033/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pixymbols/penman/) by [Roger Vershen](http://web.archive.org/web/20101203090033/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Roger%20Vershen).  
F
